AdvantageScope Banner6625×1024 506 KB

What is AdvantageScope?

AdvantageScope is a robot diagnostics, log review/analysis, and data visualization application for FRC developed by Team 6328. To learn more, check out the documentation or take a look at our conference from the 2024 FIRST Championship:

The 2025 season will mark the fourth year since AdvantageScope’s release in 2022, and we’ve come a long way; AdvantageScope is now available to every team through the WPILib installer, and the application had almost 8000 users during the 2024 season. To everyone who has used AdvantageScope, given us feedback, reported bugs, or contributed code: Thank You! You have helped make AdvantageScope what it is, and all of us on Team 6328 are grateful for that.

Swift, Simple, Smart

The 2025 version of AdvantageScope is a major upgrade, with over 130 new features and updates. We’ve highlighted a few of our favorites below.

AdvantageScope Screenshot1920×1062 273 KB

100x Faster Log Decoding

(That’s not a typo.)

Below is an hour-long 140MB log file being decoded by the 2024 and 2025 versions of AdvantageScope. The decode time goes from 30 seconds to 300 milliseconds.

All-New Timeline Interface

The timeline interface has been completely redesigned to enable precise scrubbing, with controls for zooming and panning. Auto and teleop match periods are also color coded for easier navigation.

All-New Control Interface

The visualization controls for many tabs, including the odometry and 3D field tabs have been redesigned from scratch to make the interface more simple, consistent, and capable. New features like nested objects, visibility toggles, and object settings make it easier to get started while enabling advanced new visualization options.

Control Interface1678×724 118 KB

Expanded Color Options

Several brand-new colors are available when visualizing ghosts, vision targets, and trajectories. And for the first time, multiple ghost colors are supported on the odometry tab!

Rainbow Ghosts1920×1150 211 KB

...

New Swerve Visualizations

Swerve module states can be visualized in 2D or 3D by overlaying vectors on the odometry and 3D field tabs.

Looking to go deeper? Try visualizing chassis speeds on the swerve tab, which can now display an unlimited number of data sets!

Swerve Visualizations2328×800 240 KB

Line Graph Improvements

Fields displayed on the line graph can now be customized by changing the thickness, color, and style (stepped, smooth, or points).

New integration and differentiation options, along with a streamlined unit conversion interface, make advanced analysis even easier.

Want to visualize even more data at once? Try popping out the line graph to a separate window!

Line Graph Styles1954×968 159 KB

Redesigned Statistics View

The statistics tab is redesigned with several new capabilities. It supports an unlimited number of fields with more flexibility for calculating absolute and relative errors.

New range options enable easy selection just by panning and zooming on the timeline, or look at live-updating data by showing the most recent 10 or 30 seconds while connected to a live source.

The statistics tab also supports pop-out windows for the first time!

Statistics Redesign1974×1062 180 KB

Heatmap Upgrades

Heatmaps can now be viewed on the 3D field tab! Plus, new range options allow filtering to auto, teleop, or teleop excluding endgame (to eliminate climbing sequences that throw off the visualization).

Heatmap Upgrades1920×1051 169 KB

New UI on Windows and Linux

The AdvantageScope UI on Windows has been redesigned for a cleaner look with a translucent sidebar and integrated menu and title bars. The menu bar on Linux uses the same updated style. This cleaner window design was previously only available on macOS.

Windows UI1198×686 112 KB

First-Class Struct Support

The WPILib struct format is type-safe and unit-safe, allowing 2D and 3D poses to be intermixed for the first time. Visualize 3D poses on the 2D field (or vice-versa), without ever worrying about mixing up data types or units! AdvantageScope is also smarter when suggesting possible object types, ensuring that data is always displayed correctly.

Note: As part of our transition to struct, the legacy number array format for geometry data is now deprecated. See this page for details.

2D & 3D Intermixing1655×867 242 KB

New Documentation Site

The AdvantageScope documentation has been updated to a modern look, which supports easier navigation via the sidebar and a more refined mobile interface. This documentation can be accessed online at docs.advantagescope.org, or offline by clicking the icon in the tab bar.

Documentation Screenshot2420×1504 319 KB

Changelog

The features listed above are just a sampling of what’s new in 2025. Check out the full changelog for details on the 130+ new updates available in this release.

2025 Poster1920×1080 240 KB

What’s Next?

The AdvantageScope 2025 beta is now released! You can download the beta now from the GitHub releases page, and it will also be available in the first WPILib beta release. We welcome feedback, feature requests, or bug reports on the GitHub issues page.

THIS IS A BETA RELEASE, which means that you will encounter issues not present in stable releases. We rely on your feedback and bug reports to make AdvantageScope better for everyone.

We already have several new features in the works, some of which we’ve already shown briefly. Keep an eye out for updates, and we look forward to seeing what all of you do with AdvantageScope in 2025!

catrix:

forgot to mention

There’s lots of ground to cover, but this behavior would be the new “nested objects” that are part of the redesigned control interface. The reason for the change is that it provides more flexibility for visualizing different components/vision targets/etc for multiple robots. I would recommend taking advantage of the new help menu for each tab (click the small question mark icon), which explains all of the available objects, the supported data types, and which are nested with other objects:

Screenshot 2024-09-25 at 9.48.55 PM1424×1244 246 KB

AdvantageScope 2025 Beta 2

You can download AdvantageScope beta 2 from the GitHub releases page.

The second beta release of AdvantageScope for 2025 is now available! This release adds new controls for the 3D field camera, improves the performance of many tabs, and fixes a number of bugs reported since the start of beta. Check the GitHub release for a full list of changes.

Thank you to everyone who has reported issues or suggested features over the past few weeks. Almost every change in this release was based on the excellent feedback we’ve received from the community!

AdvantageScope 2025 Beta 3

You can download AdvantageScope beta 3 from the GitHub releases page .

The third beta release of AdvantageScope for 2025 is now available! Check the GitHub release for a full list of changes, including new features and bug fixes. This update includes several significant feature updates, which we’ve highlighted below.

Unofficial REV-Compatible Logger (URCL)

We received very positive feedback following the release of URCL last year, and we’re pleased to announce that URCL is ready for 2025! The 2025.0.0-beta-1 release of URCL requires the 2025 release of Spark Max/Flex firmware, and adds support for logging directly to DataLog for users who wish to disable NetworkTables logging (by @spacey_sooty).

URCL 20252508×1538 721 KB

Alerts Visualization

Users of WPILib’s new persistent alerts API can now visualize the state of errors, warnings, and info messages over time on the line graph (docs).

Alerts Logging2142×292 36.3 KB

Console Tab Improvements

The console tab includes a number of enhancements, including color coding for warning and error messages, the ability to highlight filtered text in messages, filter unwanted messages, and export the console field to a text file.

Console Improvements2440×1562 901 KB

PhotonVision Struct Decoding

Users of the 2025 PhotonVision beta can now view all of the raw data published by PhotonVision in AdvantageScope, without needing to enable protobuf logging (by @thatmattguy).

PhotonVision Structs1920×1036 117 KB

Timeline Looping

Running a demo using AdvantageScope? Want to examine a moment in extra detail? You can now right-click the play/pause icon to loop over the visible range and rewatch those moments again and again and again…

jonahb55:

without needing to enable protobuf logging

Behind the scenes: this uses the new self-descriptive packed struct schemas, a subset/extension of the WPILib Struct schema with support for optional types and variable-length arrays and without (for now) explicit support for bitfield types. We publish schemas to /.schema/ in NetworkTables and use the schema definition hash to differentiate types. This tool still does code-gen like Protobuf, but should be lower overhead and faster to both encode and decode with the added benefit of supporting both compile-time serialization and deserialization as well as dynamic decoding for dashboards.
